[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures may impede readability despite grammatical correctness.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unrelated paragraphs (e.g., George III, Leicester Square) disrupt thematic continuity.

[LEXICON]: Overly elaborate vocabulary in some descriptions (e.g., "sun-bathed pavements"), but no grammatical/spelling errors.

[LOGIC]: Anachronistic reference to 19th-century events in a 16th-century context.
[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt shift to unrelated "SOJOURN IN VENICE" chapter without transition.
